name: v17.7.1
body: * [port Gradle's VersionNumber to avoid deprecations](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/commit/54a11cd7ba5d89b0f85309ad360a2222b27cbfbe)

name: v17.7.0
body: * Mark lint task as incompatible with configuration caching

name: v17.6.1
body:
## What's Changed
* GradleLintRule: hasConfiguration should handle project.childProjects when is empty by @rpalcolea in https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/pull/370


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/compare/v17.6.0...v17.6.1

name: v17.6.0
body:
## What's Changed
* GradleViolation: insertIntoClosure and insertIntoClosureAtTheEnd are aware of single line closures by @rpalcolea in https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/pull/369


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/compare/v17.5.0...v17.6.0

name: v17.5.0
body:
## What's Changed
* SourceSetUtils: Use plugin convention only when project is using Gradle older than 7.1 by @rpalcolea in https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/pull/362


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/compare/v17.4.0...v17.5.0

name: v17.4.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Upgrade dependencies by @rpalcolea in https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/pull/361


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/compare/v17.3.2...v17.4.0

name: v17.3.2
body:
* `BuildFiles`: enhance how we handle empty files or files with \n at the end for concatenating them

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/compare/v17.3.1...v17.3.2

name: v17.3.1
body:
## What's Changed
* Revert "Initial JDK 17 compatibility" by @rpalcolea in https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/pull/360


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/compare/v17.3.0...v17.3.1

name: v17.3.0
body: * Modify `BuildFiles` to stop using `java.io.LineNumberReader` which has a breaking change in behavior @ JDK 16.  More info in https://blogs.oracle.com/javamagazine/post/the-hidden-gems-in-java-16-and-java-17-from-streammapmulti-to-hexformat

name: v17.2.3
body: Fixes NPE caused by antlr plugin

name: v17.2.2
body: Fixed bug in android configuration handling due to incorrect prefix checking.

name: v17.2.1
body: GradleLintPlugin: change min version for modern report output

name: v17.2.0
body:
* Gradle 7.2
* Fix report generation

name: v17.1.1
body: * `DependencyService`: `getResolutionAlternatives` should be a `List<String>`

name: v17.1.0
body: Introduce `visitEndOfBuildFileProcessing` to get reliable callback at the end of build file processing. We were using `visitClassNode` previously that could be called multiple times and not exactly once.

name: v17.0.0
body: Compatibility with Gradle 7.

name: v16.26.0
body: * GradleLintRule: visitMethodCallInPlugins handles apply method

name: v16.25.0
body: * `AbstractLintPluginTaskConfigurer`: allow disabling java plugin wiring via `-PgradleLint.wireJavaPlugin=false`

name: v16.24.0
body: Fixme violations can be noncritical when a property is passed in

name: v16.23.0
body: Invoke `visitAnyObjectDependency` even for cases like `compile aVariable`

name: v16.22.0
body: rerelease 16.21.0

name: v16.21.0
body: Detect project dependencies with complex declaration of project name like `compile project("${baseName}-client")`. We will call callback `visitAnySubmoduleDependency` but project name will be `null`.

name: v16.20.0
body: Detect dependencies on submodules with map notation. E.g. `implementation project(path: ":submodule")`

name: v16.19.0
body: Detect `configuration methodCall()` use case as a dependency declaration. It will invoke `visitAnyObjectDependency` rule callback. The logic now even calls the callback when the function cannot be evaluated. It will pass an instance of `NotEvaluatedObject` with the original AST node instead of evaluated object.

name: v16.18.0
body: Detect `configuration methodCall()` use case as a dependency declaration. It will invoke `visitAnyObjectDependency` rule callback.

name: v16.17.1
body:
Fix groovy syntax and API usage to improve compatibility with upcoming Gradle 7.0 and Groovy 3.

NOTE: this release doesn't guarantee full compatibility with Gradle 7. It removes only the first wave of blockers and allows further testing.

name: v16.17.0
body: All fixes associated with a violation are applied all or none. This helps in scenarios where one fix can collide with another fix. A violation with a colliding fix will not apply any of its fixes.

name: v16.16.0
body: Callbacks providing parsed dependencies will now provide parsed dependency with original declaration preserving GString Expressions. For example: `implementation 'group:name:${version}'`. Version property will contain `${version}`

name: v16.9.1
body: Fix a bug when a rule is applying multi-line change which ends with lines with trailing newlines.

name: v16.9.0
body: XML reports will now contain packages for each submodule holding a full path to the submodule. Previous releases aggregate all files in a single package with path to the root of the project.

name: v16.8.1
body: Fix: `bypassed-forces` rule works with groovy 2.4.15

name: v16.8.0
body: Configuration whether the report task will output all violations or only violations that would be applied during fix stage.

name: v16.7.2
body: Bypassed forces rule provides warning for only the affected projects

name: v16.7.1
body: Fix failure when using the configuration for a project from root module using `project()` with the project path containing a dynamic expression.

name: v16.7.0
body:
The bypassed forces rule will provide a warning when a dependency* resolves to a version that is not the one indicated by a `force` or `strict` version constraint

\* non-buildscript dependency

name: v16.6.0
body: Add `visitAnyObjectDependency` callback into `GradleLintRule` to inspect dependencies declarations on `FileCollection` or any arbitrary code.

name: v16.5.2
body:
* Fix usage of `skipForTasks` for `GradleLintExtension`
* `skipForTasks` works with shorthand task names

name: v16.5.0
body: * AutoLint should not run when clean or dependencyInsight tasks are used

name: v16.4.0
body: Add callback `visitAnySubmoduleDependency` to inspect dependencies on other submodules within a multimodule project.

name: v16.3.1
body: Ignore nested `plugins` blocks in Gradle DSL in rules callback. A plugin could have a configuration which would use the same name method name `plugins` and rules would consider it as Gradle's `plugins` block.

name: v16.3.0
body: Introduce project property `gradleLint.reportFormat` to allow configuration of lint report format from CLI.

name: v16.2.3
body:
Should finally handle both:
* Handle when project.dependencies was interpreted as project(':name') { dependencies { }} and caused NoSuchElementException
* Dependencies defined inside project(':path') { } would be now included in visitAnyGradleDependency callback.

name: v16.2.2
body: Handle when `project.dependencies` was interpreted as `project(':name') { dependencies { }}` and caused `NoSuchElementException`

name: v16.2.1
body: * `DependencyService`: findAndReplaceDeprecatedConfiguration should handle non resolvable configuration

name: v16.2.0
body: Dependencies defined inside `project(':path') { }` would be now included in `visitAnyGradleDependency` callback.

name: v16.1.4
body: * `AbstractDuplicateDependencyClassRule`: fix support for `runtimeOnly`

name: v16.1.3
body:
* make sure that `check` task depends on `dependencyReport` ones
* `AbstractDuplicateDependencyClassRule`: handle scenario where `configuration` is not part of `DependencyService.declaredToResolvableConfigurations`, avoiding `null` scenarios

name: v16.1.2
body:
### Disable publishing of Gradle Module Metadata

This project shades & relocates dependencies. Gradle Module Metadata cannot currently be modified like a Maven POM file to remove the shaded dependency. 

### Update dependencies that are removed from POM file

'asm', 'asm-commons', and 'commons-lang' have been shaded and relocated for some time. They are now removed from the POM file as listed dependencies

name: v16.1.1
body:
### Changes

- UnusedDependencyRule, UndeclaredDependencyRule, and DuplicateDependencyClassRules work with modern configurations (resolving `compileClasspath` over `compile`, for example, and declaring dependencies on `implementation` over `compile`)
- DependencyService's resolveableConfigurations() returns those which do not have a resolution alternative
- UnusedDependencyRule suggests a configuration to move dependencies to, if it was needed only in an extending configuration

### Uses

- Gradle 6.2
- nebula.plugin-plugin version '14.1.3'
- more tests use nebula-test IntegrationTestKitSpec over internal TestKitSpecification

name: v16.1.0
body:
Update: this did not publish to MavenCentral/ Bintray. Republishing as 16.1.1

### Changes

- UnusedDependencyRule, UndeclaredDependencyRule, and DuplicateDependencyClassRules work with modern configurations (resolving `compileClasspath` over `compile`, for example, and declaring dependencies on `implementation` over `compile`)
- DependencyService's resolveableConfigurations() returns those which do not have a resolution alternative
- UnusedDependencyRule suggests a configuration to move dependencies to, if it was needed only in an extending configuration

### Uses

- Gradle 6.2
- nebula.plugin-plugin version '14.1.3'
- more tests use nebula-test IntegrationTestKitSpec over internal TestKitSpecification

name: v16.0.2
body: * Configure `AbstractCompile` tasks lazily

name: v16.0.1
body: * Task configuration avoidance for wiring java plugin (https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/pull/267)

name: v16.0.0
body: * Introduce task configuration avoidance for lint tasks

name: v15.0.3
body:
* `DeprecatedDependencyConfigurationRule`: only warn as we don't know real user intentions
* `AbstractDuplicateDependencyClassRul`: handle configurations that are not resolvable

name: v15.0.0
body:
# Introduce api/implementation configuration support

Since we need to do some major work to keep track of declared configurations and then replace code with the proper configuration, we decided to just show warnings for now.

This work includes finding dependency information for non resolvable configurations so we look into the parents

If gradle/gradle#11106 lands some day, we could definitely enhance this experience.

While it is great to have automatic fix, not having it is worse. So for now warning about this with the same detail as before is much better than a broken experience with new Gradle configurations

Because of this, we consider the change as a breaking one.

name: v14.2.5
body: `DeprecatedDependencyConfigurationRule`: `extractProject` only supports `ConstantExpressions`

name: v14.2.3
body: remove static compilation from unused dependency - problems with collect

name: v14.0.1
body: Making sure we are not pulling in prerelease transitive dependencies of asm libraries

name: v13.1.7
body: Update dependencies

name: v13.1.6
body: Upgrade to com.netflix.nebula:nebula-gradle-interop:1.0.10

name: v13.1.1
body: Revert recent modification of the way how auto linting is added at the end of the build because it is probably causing issues with parallel multi-module builds.

name: v13.1.0
body: Remove usage of deprecated DefaultVersionSelectorScheme constructor

name: v12.1.0
body:
* Duplicate META-INF/versions/9/module-info do not cause violations. Closes #246
* Upgrade to Kotlin 1.3.41
* plugin-plugin 12.1.0

name: v12.0.0
body:
Use `ObjectFactory` to create `CodeNarcImpl` object. 

This only works with Gradle 4.2+

name: v11.5.0
body: Exclude compileOnly configurations from resolution. They are marked as resolvable but they conceptually should not be resolved because they are only dependency containers.

name: v11.4.0
v11.3.0
body: Add support for `OpCodes` in `MethodReference`

name: v11.1.0
body: Reverts `gradleLint` configuration because of potential conflicts with dependency locking

name: v11.0.0
body:
Introduce Gradle Lint configuration for classpath isolation.
This is a breaking change if you have custom rules in your classpath.

name: v10.5.3
body: include asm utils, tree, analysis and common to shade dependencies

name: v10.5.0
body: Shade ASM to prevent conflicts on consumer side

name: v10.4.1
body: Ignore deprecation warnings during lint tasks

name: v10.3.5
body: Ignore deprecation warnings for `CodeNarcReportImpl`

name: v10.3.4
body: Upgrade plugins

name: v10.3.3
body: `UndeclaredDependenciesRule` class can be extended to customize what modules will be suggested as undeclared.

name: v10.3.2
body:
Upgrade asm to 7.0
Refactoring of undeclared dependencies rule

name: v10.3.1
body: Make `gradle-info-plugin` only compileOnly dependency to limit dependencies of this plugin.

name: v10.3.0
body: Upgrade to kotlin 1.3.0

name: v10.2.0
body:
Rule to replace deprecated dependency configurations.

compile -> implementation
testCompile -> testImplementation
runtime -> runtimeOnly

This can be applied via `deprecated-dependency-configuration` rule. Ex. `gradleLint.rules = ['deprecated-dependency-configuration']`

name: v10.1.3
body: Fixed: GradleDependency can't parse dependency without version

name: v10.1.2
body: Upgrade plugins for groovy 2.5 support

name: v10.1.1
body: Upgrade plugins for groovy 2.5 support

name: Upgrade to Gradle 4.10.1
body: Upgrade to Gradle 4.10.1

Breaking change
===

support only for Gradle 4.0+

name: v9.3.4
body: Rules work well with java library plugin

name: v9.3.3
body: Plugin fail fast when applied to a project using kotlin script which is not supported.

name: v9.3.2
body:
* Critical lint violations fail the build - for fixes that require activation as well
* Updates to make plugin compatible with Gradle 4.8

name: v9.3.1
body:
Excluding auto lint task from CLI with (-x autoLintGradle) works again.
Fix line counting in build files on different OS.

name: v9.3.0
body:
* Undeclared dependency rule
* Preparation for Gradle 4.8

name: v9.1.0
body:
* Create `criticalLintGradle` task for an ability to run verification sooner
* Add more options to configure when to run automatic lint execution

name: v9.1.0-rc.1
body:
* Create `criticalLintGradle` task for an ability to run verification sooner
* Add more options to configure when to run automatic lint execution

- use buildFiles for linting nested gradle build files
- when configured correctly to use internal gradle's improved pom support, remove version numbers from dependencies whose versions are managed in a provided bom
- add visitor helper methods, including the ability to insert content at the end of a given closure

name: v8.3.2
body: Fix Gradle 4.0 classesDir deprecation warnings when calculating class references

name: v8.3.1
body: Don't consider `module-info` and `package-info` classes duplicates.

name: v8.3.0
body: The manual lint task, `lintGradle` now fails on any violation, instead of only critical violations, allowing lint violation checks to be automated

name: v8.2.2
body: * Handle dependencies with classifiers

name: v8.2.1
body: * Don't remove version from dependency with a closure containing `force = true`

name: v8.2.0
body: * Allow `EmptyClosureRule` to be customized to only delete certain blocks

name: v8.1.0
body: * Helper method to replace whole dependencies

name: v8.0.0
body:
Add additional dependency visitor methods, which behave slightly different than they did before
Add a DependencyHelper for removing and replacing versions

name: v7.9.5
body:
Allow the `DependencyService` to be reinitialized, as the lint violation report task collects violations again (Fixes #137):

    Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: DependencyService has been removed from this project
        at com.netflix.nebula.lint.rule.dependency.DependencyService.forProject(DependencyService.groovy:38)
        at com.netflix.nebula.lint.rule.dependency.DependencyService$forProject.call(Unknown Source)

name: v7.9.4
body:
* Added support for `GradleModelAware` rules in `AbstractRuleSpec`. (@jmcampanini)
* Corrected indention of insertions into closures. (@jmcampanini)

name: v7.9.3
body: Actually release each project during analysis, previous solution only affected the root project

name: v7.9.2
body: Avoid excessive memory consumption during lint by discarding memoized dependency service results

name: v7.9.1
body: Attempt to publish v7.9.0

name: v7.9.0
body: Add rules to deal with nebula plugin renames

name: v7.8.0
body: Re-publish of previous release due to gaps in JCenter/Maven Central publication.

name: v7.5.0
body: Gradle 4.0 compatibility (change in VersionComparator contract)

name: v7.4.0
body: New rule to lint `nebula.nebula-release` to `nebula.release`

name: v7.3.5
body: Fix Java 7 compatibility issues introduced by JDK 8 class leaking into compiled class file

name: v7.3.3
body: Log duplicate dependency messages at `--info` level to assist with troubleshooting

name: v7.3.2
body: Additional performance for duplicate dependency class by moving performance critical code to Kotlin

name: v7.3.1
body: Improve performance of duplicate dependency class rules by compiling class statically

name: v7.3.0
body:
Duplicate dependency classes are now detected by two rules:

- `duplicate-dependency-class` - first order dependencies that have class duplicates with any other dependency
- `transitive-duplicate-dependency-class` - only transitive dependencies that have duplicates

This allows the former to be considered an actionable, critical violation if desired.

name: v7.2.8
body: Remove `apply from` support - the approach we used is incompatible with rules that use bookmarks or otherwise make assumptions that they'll be dealing with a single compilation unit.

name: v7.2.7
body: Fixes AST parsing fails with 'java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: A source must be specified' (#100)

name: v7.2.6
body: Prevent duplicate violations from duplicate class rule (oh the irony) due to dependencies that include multiple artifacts in their default Ivy configuration

name: v7.2.5
body: Include the full path to the configuration in the duplicate dependency rule violation message

name: v7.2.4
body:
Duplicate dependency rule improvements:
- Duplicates in transitive dependencies will now trigger violations (#98)
- Duplicate class names are output when build is run in `--debug` mode (#62)

name: v7.2.3
body: Fix file descriptor leak in dependency service when reading class references

name: v7.2.2
body:
Fix class resolution failures caused by `apply from` support:

	> startup failed:
	  script1489698227946.groovy: 14: unable to resolve class DependencyResolveDetails 
	   @ line 14, column 36.
	                         eachDependency { DependencyResolveDetails details ->

name: v7.2.1
body: Remove static memoization from dependency service, avoiding classloader level memory leak in the Gradle daemon

name: v7.2.0
body:
- Bind the dependency service used for dependency lint rules as an extension, rather than a class level static, to avoid leaking memory on the daemon
- Fixed duplicate warnings from unused-dependency when adding dependencies (fixes #53)
- Add test for reported issue related to unused-dependency-exclude on an unresolvable dependency (closes #57)
- Support following and linting targets (fixes #84)
- Preserve carriage returns when generating patches (fixes #37)

name: v7.1.0
body:
* Fix a regression in duplicate-dependency-classes that throws an NPE when a configuration cannot be found (thanks @remy-tiitre)
* Add support for [excluding rules](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/wiki/Excluding-Rules) (especially rules derived from rule groups) from either an extension property or Gradle property
* [Add support](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/wiki/Ignoring-Violations#fixme) for `gradleLint.fixme(DATE) { ... }` blocks, which act like `gradleLint.ignore { ... }` but fail the build at some defined time in the future when lint tasks are run.

name: v7.0.0
body:
* Implementation of a [minimum-dependency-version](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/wiki/Minimum-Dependency-Version-Rule) rule
* Substantial changes to the AST visiting mechanism to better detect property-based DSL access (rather than just nested closures)

name: v6.8.0
body:
- Override rules/critical rules with `gradleLint.rules` project property
- Defensively trap ASM class reader exceptions (fixes #88)
- Defensively catch `NoClassDefFoundError` when determining a class type (fixes #88)

The override allows you to substitute a rule or set of rules for those that were defined in the project's `gradleLint` extension object, e.g. `./gradlew fixGradleLint -PgradleLint.rules=myrule1,myrule2`. Override with multiple rules by comma separating the rule ids in the property definition.

name: v6.7.0
body: Compatibility with `Configuration.isResolvable()` changes in Gradle 3.4

name: v6.6.0
body: Exempt `wrapper` task from automatic lint

name: v6.5.0
body: Make running automatic lint after failure optional, via `autoLintAfterFailure` extension property.

name: v6.4.0
body:
`autoLintGradle` is now skipped if any other task failed during the build, avoiding:
- Having to wait for the failure while lint is running
- Dependency related failures, which also fail in lint, cause long compound build failures

name: v6.3.0
body: Shade org.eclipse.jdt:core

name: v6.2.2
body: - Fixed regression on `gradleLint.alwaysRun` extension property (fixes #79).

name: v6.2.1
body: - Downgrade info plugin

name: v6.2.0
body: - When calling `lintGradle` or `fixLintGradle` or `fixGradleLint` auto run compile tasks so all rules can work

name: v6.1.4
body: - Fix display of lint rule message

name: v6.1.3
body: - Fix formatting of lint warnings that do not have source attachments

name: v6.1.2
body:
- Fix attempt to create a GradlePlugin object from an unexpected method call in plugins (#75)
- Fix reference to logger field in GradleLintRule which is hit when lint encounters an un-evaluatable dependency declaration.

name: v6.1.1
body: - Fix info-broker integration reference to violation level introduced in 6.0.0 (@remy-tiitre)

name: v6.1.0
body: - Detect dependencies defined with extension properties (fixes #67)

name: v6.0.0
body:
- Introduced a `gradleLint.criticalRules` extension property that allows you to define the set of rules that will fail a build should they be violated
- Removed the level concept from violations in favor of defining critical/non-critical rules

name: v5.2.0
body:
- Fix backwards compatible colorizing (#63)
- Allow configuration of lintGradle task invocation behavior (#68)
- Upgrade to jgit 4.5.0, gradle-info 3.3.4 (#64)
- Archaic wrapper task now supports Gradle patch versions (#69 thanks to @remy-tiitre)
- GradleAstVisitor support for buildscript block, and gradle plugin block (#60 thanks to @felipefzdz)

name: v5.1.2
body: Fixed formatting of unused-dependency-exclude rule message (thanks @remy-tiitre!)

name: v5.1.0
body:
- Support compileOnly configuration (fixes #46)
- Indicate which violations are not auto-fixable (fixes #35)
- Consider dependencies with no versions in dependency rules (fixes #45)
- Gradle 2.X and Gradle 3.0 compatible use of `StyledTextOutput`
- Ignore classes generated by interface fields (fixes #52)
- duplicate-dependency-class can now be ignored (fixes #43)
- Don't consider conflict resolved versions to contain duplicate classes (fixes #47)

name: v5.0.0
body: Introduced a backwards incompatible change to support Gradle 3.0. This release was a mistake and using it is NOT recommended!

name: v4.0.1
body:
- Detect duplicate dependencies when dependencies are defined with extension properties
- Fix bug associating configuration to nearest source set (fixes #39)

name: v4.0.0
body:
- Add experimental Android support to `unused-dependency`
- Fix `NoClassDefFoundError` when assessing the type hierarchy of compiled sources

name: v3.31.5
body: Attempt another release. There appears to be a problem with Travis seeing the previous tag

name: v0.31.2
body: Attempt to republish failed artifacts.

name: v0.30.10
body: Add `message` field to violations reported to the info plugin

name: v0.30.4
body: `overridden-dependency-version` rule will no longer affect `latest.${status}` style constraints

name: v0.30.3
body:
Backwards compatible with Gradle 2.14, fixes:

```
Caused by: groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method: org.gradle.logging.DeprecatedStyledTextOutputFactory.create() is applicable for argument types: (java.lang.String) values: [lint]
Possible solutions: create(java.lang.Class), getAt(java.lang.String), grep(), iterator(), print(java.io.PrintWriter), grep(java.lang.Object)
```

name: v0.30.0
body: archaic-wrapper rule and visitTask enhancement

name: v0.28.1
body: - Upgrade to JGit 4.4.0-SNAPSHOT

name: v0.27.0
body: Added the [unused-dependency-version](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/gradle-lint-plugin/wiki/Overridden-Dependency-Version-Rule) rule.

name: v0.26.2
body: - Fix LintService violation aggregation

name: v0.26.1
body: Fix for patches that overlap at the start of their ranges.

name: v0.26.0
body: Rewrite of unused dependency rule

name: v0.24.1
body: Shade and relocate JGit into the distribution so that the plugin may be resolved against Maven Central alone.

name: v0.24.0
body: Shadow jgit since we are using a snapshot.

name: v0.23.0
body: - Add ability to create/delete files and symlinks for lint fixes. Supports non-AST violations.

name: v0.22.0
body:
- Significant changes to the underlying model
- The process of adding violations is now done with a fluent API, allowing for multiple fixes to compose
- `unused-dependency` now relocates jars that contain no classes to the runtime configuration
- `lintGradle` now generates build/lint.patch in the root project. This gives you the option of running `git apply build/lint.patch` rather than `./gradlew fixGradleLint` and opens up the door for lint fixes that apply to more than just build.gradle.
- Added Trivial and Info levels.

name: v0.21.1
body: - Add report once instead of for each project

name: v0.21.0
body: - Publish violations to InfoBroker
